Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a habitat on land or in water, such as a playground, garden, forest, parking lot, pond, stream, or lake.
The student can illustrate different kinds of living things within the chosen habitat, including plants like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can illustrate different kinds of animals in the habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can compare and show at least two different habitats in their drawing, highlighting the variety of plants and animals in each.
The student can show patterns by identifying similar types of plants or animals that appear in both habitats.
